meanings.definition: To spend time making minor adjustments to one's appearance
meanings.sent1: She likes to primp before going out, fixing her hair and adjusting her outfit.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, she primps in front of the mirror, ensuring everything looks just right.
meanings.sent3: After hours of primping, she finally felt confident in her appearance.
meanings.sent4: She primped like a painter perfecting every stroke on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: Her meticulous primping routine became a daily ritual.

meanings.sent1: He would primp himself before important meetings, making sure he looked presentable.
meanings.sent2: The cat primped its fur after a nap, licking it clean with care.
meanings.sent3: She primped herself as if preparing for a royal ball, even though it was just a casual gathering.
meanings.sent4: The bird primped its feathers, showing off its vibrant colors in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Primping before the date, he wanted to make a good impression.

meanings.definition: To make oneself look more attractive by tidying or arranging one's clothes, hair, or makeup.
meanings.sent1: She would primp her hair and adjust her dress before taking a selfie.
meanings.sent2: Before the party, she primped in front of the mirror, adding a touch of lipstick.
meanings.sent3: He primped himself up for the costume party, looking like a movie star.
meanings.sent4: The flowers primped themselves with dewdrops, shining in the morning light.
meanings.sent5: Primping with a smile, she felt ready to face the day.
